means: 有规律地，按时，照例，按部就班地

sameAnalysis.word_list: always, often, usually, frequently, repeatedly, regularly
means: always ：总是，永远。语气最强，指在一切时候，没有例外。
often ：经常，语气弱于always,侧重动作发生的次数具有经常性，具体时间意味不强。
usually ：通常，通例地，指习惯性动作，频度仅次于always，较often大，偶尔有间隔。
frequently ：时常，经常，与often同义，可通用，但较正式，强调次数频繁。
repeatedly ：屡次，强调次数多，但反复的频率不一定均匀。
regularly ：用于修饰经常而有规律性的动作。

sentence.Network_en: The President's speeches are regularly reproduced verbatim in the state-run newspapers.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统的讲话通常会被一字不差地刊登在国有报纸上。

sentence.Network_en: Check the oil at regular intervals, and have the car serviced regularly.
sentence.Network_cn: 定期检查汽油，并对车辆进行定期维护。

sentence.Network_en: Fox, badger, weasel and stoat are regularly seen here.
sentence.Network_cn: 狐狸、獾、黄鼠狼和白鼬在这里很常见。

entry.tran: 定时的;定期的;有规律的
entry.def: Regular events have equal amounts of time between them, so that they happen, for example, at the same time each day or each week.

example.ex: Take regular exercise...
example.tran: 定期进行锻炼。

example.ex: Now it's time for our regular look at the world of international sport...
example.tran: 现在我们再来关注一下国际体坛的消息。

example.ex: ...after a morning punctuated by regular volleys of gunfire...
example.tran: 过了枪声阵阵的早上之后

example.ex: This condition usually clears up with regular shampooing.
example.tran: 这种情形通常多用香波洗洗头即可消除。

entry.def: If you are, for example, a regular customer at a shop or a regular visitor to a place, you go there often.

example.ex: 'Tell me, Mr Mentakis, was Mrs Savalas one of your regular customers?'...
example.tran: “告诉我，门塔基斯先生，萨瓦拉斯夫人是您的常客吗？”

example.ex: She has become a regular visitor to Houghton Hall.
example.tran: 她已经成了霍顿府的常客。

entry.tran: 常客;老顾客;固定成员;正式成员
entry.def: The regulars at a place or in a team are the people who often go to the place or are often in the team.

example.ex: Regulars at his local pub have set up a fund to help out...
example.tran: 经常光顾他的酒吧的人伸出援手成立了一个基金会。

example.ex: I wasn't one of their regulars.
example.tran: 我并不是他们的正式成员。

entry.def: You use regular when referring to the thing, person, time, or place that is usually used by someone. For example, someone's regular place is the place where they usually sit.

example.ex: The man sat at his regular table near the window.
example.tran: 这个人坐在他固定的靠窗的位置。

example.ex: ...samples from one of their regular suppliers.
example.tran: 他们的一个固定供货商提供的样品

entry.def: A regular rhythm consists of a series of sounds or movements with equal periods of time between them.

example.ex: ...a very regular beat...
example.tran: 非常规律的节拍

example.ex: He stood in the doorway, listening to her quiet, regular breathing.
example.tran: 他站在走道里，听着她那沉静而规律的呼吸声。

example.ex: The product looks and burns like a regular cigarette...
example.tran: 这种产品看起来和点燃后都与常见的香烟没什么两样。

example.ex: He describes himself as just a regular guy from suburban Chicago.
example.tran: 他说自己就是一个从芝加哥郊区来的普通人。

entry.tran: (饮品或食物)分量适中的，中份的
entry.def: In some restaurants, a regular drink or quantity of food is of medium size.

example.ex: ...a cheeseburger and regular fries.
example.tran: 一个奶酪汉堡和中份薯条

entry.tran: 整齐排列的;（空距）均匀的
entry.def: A regular pattern or arrangement consists of a series of things with equal spaces between them.

example.ex: ...strange small rounded sandy hillocks, that look as if they've been scattered in a regular pattern on the ground.
example.tran: 奇怪的圆形小沙丘，看上去好像是被整齐地散放在地上似的

example.ex: ...regular rows of wooden huts.
example.tran: 整齐的一排排小木屋

entry.def: If something has a regular shape, both halves are the same and it has straight edges or a smooth outline.

example.ex: ...some regular geometrical shape.
example.tran: 一些对称的几何图形

entry.def: Regular troops are professional soldiers who are a permanent part of an official national army.

example.ex: Most schemes attempt to reduce the cost of defence through a smaller regular army...
example.tran: 大多数方案都试图通过缩减常备军的规模来降低国防支出。

example.ex: Only about a third of the reinforcements will be regular troops.
example.tran: 增援部队中仅有约1/3是常备军。

entry.tran: (语法中)按规则变化的，规则的
entry.def: In grammar, a regular verb, noun, or adjective inflects in the same way as most verbs, nouns, or adjectives in the language.

means.word_mean: 3. in a regular way without variation;

auth_sentence.content: People who use them regularly seem to do that.
auth_sentence.res_content: People who use them regularly seem to do that.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People who use them regularly seem to do that.

auth_sentence.content: The region has had them regularly down the years.
auth_sentence.res_content: The region has had them regularly down the years.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The region has had them regularly down the years.

auth_sentence.content: When did the BBC start to record programmes regularly?
auth_sentence.res_content: When did the BBC start to record programmes regularly?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When did the BBC start to record programmes regularly?

Sentence.sentence: And clearly, people over age 75 who have other risk factors for cancer, such as a family history or prior personal experience with the disease, should continue to get screened regularly.
Heidrich now visits websites that discuss gaming addiction regularly "to remind myself to keep my love for online games in check.
Toebe also regularly visits a site where posters discuss Internet overuse
Smith gives lectures regularly on TOne great challenge for the U.S. economy is slack domestic consumer demand. Americans are paying down debt, saving more, and spending more carefully.read>0
It comes regularly from its donors.

If you are having these types of coffee regularly then they will increase the chances of you becoming overweight, which in turn increases your risk of developing cancer, as well as other diseases such as heart disease.

sentences.en: business people who travel regularly to the US
We meet regularly to discuss business.
sentences.cn: 我们定期会面讨论事务。

sentences.en: Ferry boats ply regularly between all the resorts on the lake.
sentences.cn: 渡船定时往返于湖的各旅游景点。

sentences.en: Check the engine oil level regularly.
Any worker who is regularly late will soon be brought to book.
sentences.cn: 很快就要让每一个经常迟到的工人作出解释。
